member.name: M:FistCore.Core.BlobEntityFiller`1.GetColumnNamesSortedForUsageInFromObjectArray
member.summary: Gets table column names sorted in the same order as they are initialized in entity's method.
member.returns: Array of columns names ordered in same way as collection.

remarks.para: Default implementation assumes that the order of field initialization in FromObjectArray method equals the order of items in collection. In case that this not true then this method must be overrided and it has to return column names ordered in same way as object array in the FromObjectArray are accessed.
Templates shipped with FistCore generator generate code that read object array in the same order as definied in collection.

member.summary: Encapsulates a connection and transaction objects that can be shared among data-access tier objects.

member.summary: Opens the connection object. Throws exception if it's already open.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Starts a new ADO.NET transaction using the open connection object of this class. Opens the connection if it isn't already open. No nesting allowed, throws exception if the transaction is already pending.
member.remarks: Uses default .

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider.BeginTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Starts a new ADO.NET transaction using the open connection object of this class. Opens the connection if it isn't already open. No nesting allowed, throws exception if the transaction is already pending.
member.param: The transaction isolation level.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider.CommitTransaction
member.summary: Commits a pending transaction on the open connection object of this class. Throws exception if there is no pending transaction.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider.RollbackTransaction
member.summary: Rolls back a transaction from a pending state. Throws exception if there is no pending transaction.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes the connection to the database. This is the preferred method of closing any open connection.

remarks.para: The Close method rolls back any pending transactions. It then releases the connection to the connection pool, or closes the connection if connection pooling is disabled. It is a good practice to explicitly close connection immediately after it is no longer required.
Does nothing if the connection has already been closed.

member.returns: Prefixed alias.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IDbColumn.RenderColumnName(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders column name for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.
StringBuilder to which column name is appended.
member.remarks: Special characters are handled differently on different DBMSs. Eg. if column contains blanks it has to be enclosed in brackets for SQL Server (eg. [Employee ID]).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IDbColumn.RenderFullName(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders full name for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IDbColumn.RenderAlias(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders table alias for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.
StringBuilder to which the alias is appended.
member.remarks: Special characters are handled differently on different DBMSs. If alias contains blanks it has to be enclosed in brackets for SQL Server (eg. [My employees]), in quotes for Oracle (eg. "My employees") etc.

member.summary: Execution statistics for SQL commands sent from application to database.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of CommandExecutionStatistics class.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of CommandExecutionStatistics class.
member.param: Reference to the command that was executed on the data-source. Nullable. Typically a string or an SqlStatementBase object.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.StopTime
member.summary: Sets the EndTime property to the DateTime.Now value.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time before the command is executed.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time after the command is executed.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.Duration
member.summary: Gets the total duration of command execution.
member.remarks: Includes the time required to send the command to the data-source, time to execute the command on the data-source and time to return query results back to the application.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.CommandExecutionStatistics.Command
member.summary: Gets ot sets the reference to the command that was executed on the data-source. Nullable. Typically a string or an SqlStatementBase object.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.DbmsType
member.summary: Enumeration of supported relational database management systems.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SqlServer_7
member.summary: SQL Server 7. Different AUTO IDENTITY retrieval than newer versions.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SqlServer_2000
member.summary: SQL Server 2000.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SqlServer_2005
member.summary: SQL Server 2005. Optimized hierarchical queries using recursive CTEs (WITH clause) and bulk inserts using BPC.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SqlServer_2008
member.summary: SQL Server 2008 or newer. Same as SQL Server 2005.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.Oracle_9i
member.summary: Oracle 9i. Same as Oracle 10g and 11g.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.Oracle_10g
member.summary: Oracle 10g. Same as Oracle 9i and 11g.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.Oracle_11g
member.summary: Oracle 11g or newer. Same as Oracle 9i and 10g.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.OdbcGeneric
member.summary: Generic ODBC. TOP is not supported. Auto-incremented fields are not supported.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.OleGeneric
member.summary: Generic OLE DB. TOP is not supported. Auto-incremented fields are not supported.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.MySql_5
member.summary: MySQL 5.0 or newer with InnoDB or MyISAM engine. Hierarchical updates, ie. IEntityDAO.UpdateTree() methods, are not supported.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.PostgreSql_9
member.summary: PostgreSQL 9.0 or newer. Currently, SERIAL data-type must be used for auto-incremented fields. Stand-alone sequences are not supported in INSERT statement.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.Firebird_2
member.summary: Firebird 2.1 or newer. Currently, GENERATORS and TRIGGERS must be used for auto-incremented fields. Stand-alone sequences are not supported in INSERT statement.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SQLite_3
member.summary: SQLite 3.0 or newer.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.DbmsType.SqlServerCe_4
member.summary: SQL Server Compact 4.0 or newer. SQL CE doesn't support subqueries in SELECT list.

member.summary: Creates and executes query using the given ConnectionProvider which returns multiple result-sets.

member.summary: Executes non data-retrieval stament (update, insert, delete, stored procedure).
member.param: Connection provider.
Command text.
Command parameters.
Command type (stored procedure or text).
Set timeout for specified command.
member.returns: Number of rows affected by the command.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.DbUtil.ExecuteReader(FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider,System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.IObjectFiller,System.String,FistCore.Core.DbParameterCollection,System.Data.CommandType,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes a query and converts data to specified objects.
member.param: Connection provider.
A collection to fill with objects built from data.
Builds objects directly from retrieved data.
Command text.
Command parameters.
Command type (stored procedure or text).
Set timeout for specified command.
Uses CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess instead of CommandBehavior.SingleResult.

remarks.para: The method uses provided converter to directly build specified object type from data contained in objects, thus skipping the need to create intermediate data structures such as and objects. This can increase performance and reduce memory consumption when working with very large results sets.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.IEntity)
member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.
member.param: FK.
Parent entity.
member.remarks: All child entities in the collection will share the same parent object instance (same reference).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.IEntity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.
member.param: FK.
Parent entity.

Indicates if all child entities in the collection will share the same parent object instance (same reference). If set to false, a clone of the parent will be created for each child entity in the current collection.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.
member.param: FK.
Collection of all parent entities referenced by child entities in the current collection. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated.

remarks.p: The method will try to find a parent in the provided collection for each child entity in the current collection. Child whose FK is not set are skipped. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated. If a child's FK is invalid, i.e. only partially set, an exception will be generated.
Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.
member.param: FK.
Collection of all parent entities referenced by child entities in the current collection. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated.

Indicates if child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference). If set to false, a clone of a parent will be created for each child entity in the current collection.

remarks.p: The method will try to find a parent in the provided collection for each child entity in the current collection. Child whose FK is not set are skipped. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated. If a child's FK is invalid, i.e. only partially set, an exception will be generated.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation
member.summary: Models a many-to-many relation using two one-to-many relations through a junction table.
member.remarks: In a many-to-many (M:N) relationship, a row in one table can have many matching rows in antoher table, and vice versa. These two tables are primary tables of a many-to-many relation. An M:N relationship between two primary tables is created by using a third table, called a junction table, whose primary key consists of the foreign keys from both primary tables.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.#ctor(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.DbRelation)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ManyToManyRelation class.
member.param: Relation between the junction table and the first primary table.
Relation between the junction table and the second primary table.

member.summary: Gets the first primary table of the M:N relation.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.FirstTableToJunction
member.summary: Gets the relation between the junction table and the first primary table.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.SecondPrimaryTable
member.summary: Gets the second primary table of the M:N relation.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.SecondTableToJunction
member.summary: Gets the relation between the junction table and the second primary table.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.JunctionTable
member.summary: Gets the junction table of the M:N relation.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.IsRecursive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the M:N relation is recursive, i.e. if a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation.JunctionRowsFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the that filters out junction rows. Only junction table fields may be used in the filter.

remarks.p: Default value is null, which means that all junction rows represent a valid link between two tables.

Database is often designed so that the junction rows are never deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. The JunctionRowsFilter may be used to filter out the rows which are marked as inactive.
Use only simple filters. The search condition may only reference table fields from the junction table; otherwise an error will occur. Use when complex filtering is required.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.RelationBucket
member.summary: Contains relations and additional information required to build a complete join path.

remarks.para: Data-access tier objects use RelationBucket to automatically build a FROM clause. Algorithm ensures that joins are always rendered in the the correct order regardles of the order in which the relations have been added to the bucket. Outer joins are propagated if necessary.
RelationBucket also provides an easy way to create complex objects (see ).

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.RelationBucket.joinModes

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.DbTable
member.summary: Contains database table/view metadata and methods. Factory class for related IEntity, EntityCollection and ADO.NET objects.

Provides methods for the creation of the compatibile ADO.NET objects (see ) and contains metadata for the table/view it represents such as:
Catalog data to which to which the table belongs to.
Table name and optional alias.
Fields owned by the table.
Primary key data.
Foreign keys.

member.summary: Changes aliases of all columns so that they start with prefix (usually table name). Eg: Id -> MyTable_Id
member.remarks: Avoid using SetPrefixedAliases() as it changes internal state of table objects. Use Clone(string, bool) method and generated constructor overloads to instantiate a new object, instead. The method will be removed in a future release.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.IDbTable.EntityDaoCreationStrategy
member.summary: Gets DAO creation strategy/algorithm. Default is null. Inherited classes may override behavior.

remarks.p: Inherited classes may override this property to specify a specific DAO creation strategy. checks this property to see if there is a specific implementation for an entity.

Generated code may use specific DAO with stored procedures to optimize performance. Algorithm that knows how to instantiate such DAOs is specified here. DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy will then create optimized DAOs instead of generic object that uses dynamic queries.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.IDbTable.ColumnAliasesArePrefixed
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether columns' aliases are prefixed and changed whenever the table alias is changed.
member.remarks: Usually columns aliases are prefixed with a table name/alias. This ensures the uniqueness of column aliases when selecting two columns with the same name from two different tables.

member.remarks: The ExtendedProperties property lets you configure custom information for the table such as DBMS-specific properties.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.DbTable.SetPrefixedAliases
member.summary: Changes aliases of all columns so that they start with prefix (usually table name). Eg: Id -> MyTable_Id
member.remarks: Avoid using SetPrefixedAliases() as it changes internal state of table objects. Use Clone(string, bool) method and constructor overloads to instantiate a new object, instead. The method will be marked as obsolete in a future release and eventually it may be removed alltogether.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.DbTable.InitForeignKeys
member.summary: Initializes an array of relations used by foreign keys. Inherited classes must implement this method. The method is called when property is accessed for the first time.
member.remarks: It is not wise to call this method in a constructor. If a recursive relation is defined, or there is a circular path between multiple tables, an endless loop of InitForeignKeys might occur. It is best to call the method only when relations are required, i.e. accessed.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.DbTable.EntityDaoCreationStrategy
member.summary: Gets DAO creation strategy/algorithm. Default is null.

remarks.p: Inherited classes may override this property to specify a specific DAO creation strategy. checks this property to see if there is a specific implementation for an entity.

Generated code may use specific DAOs with stored procedures to optimize performance. Algorithm that knows how to instantiate such DAOs is specified here. DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy will then create optimized DAOs instead of generic object that uses dynamic queries.

member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.

Parent entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityCollection`2.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Sets the parent defined by the given relation for all entities in the collection.
member.param: FK.
Collection of all parent entities referenced by child entities in the current collection. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated.

remarks.p: The method will try to find a parent in the provided collection for each child entity in the current collection. Child whose FK is not set are skipped. If any child references a parent which is not provided, an exception will be generated. If a child's FK is invalid, i.e. only partially set, an exception will be generated.
Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityCollection`2.SetParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.EntityBase
member.summary: Represents a single database entity with data-access functionality. Class members are mapped to table fields. Provides generic methods for manipulating entity and table data.
member.remarks:
Main features:
Class members are mapped to table fields. An instance of the class represents a row in the database.
CRUD methods. Create, retrieve, update and delete methods that manipulate a single row in the database using primary key logic. All CRUD methods have a suffix One.
Tracks current entity state in regard to data-source: new, synchronised, out-of-sync, deleted.
Maps relations to parent entities and uses foreign key fields to fetch them.
Validation.
Conversion to/from the ADO.NET object.
Retrieval of child entities using one-to-many and many-to-many relations.
Batch manipulation and retrieval of multiple rows.
Aggregate functions.
Sorting of retrieved rows on database or in application.
Connection and transaction sharing with other data-tier objects.
Hierarchical queries and updates - methods with a suffix Tree.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.EntityModelBase
member.summary: Models data structure and behavior of a database entity.

remarks.p: Doesn't implement any data-access operations.

Features:
Class members are mapped to table fields. An instance of the class represents a row in the database.
Tracks current entity state in regard to data-source: new, synchronised, out-of-sync, deleted.
Maps relations to parent entities. Inherited classes may implement data-acces logic for automatic relationship navigation.
Validation.
Conversion to/from the ADO.NET object.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the real-time null-check for non-nullable fields is performed.
member.remarks: When set to true getters mapped to table fields generate an exception if accessed before a value has been set. When set to false getters return default values if accessed before a value has been set (eg. zero for non-nullable integer fields).

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.IEntity.RelationshipNavigationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether the entity is allowed to automatically navigate the database via relations (when not explicitly ordered).

remarks.p: Has no affect on entity classes that don't implement data-access logic.
If entity relationship navigation is enabled, the method and properties mapped to parent entities (via foreign keys) will automatically try to fetch the parent entity if it isn't already fetched.

If entity relationship navigation is disabled, the GetParent method and properties mapped to parent entities (via foreign keys) will not automatically access the data-source to fetch the parent entity. Thus, if the parent isn't already initialized, null will be returned.
Default behavior is not standardized. See documentation for classes that implement the IEntity interface.

remarks.p: If entity relationship navigation is enabled, the method and properties mapped to parent entities (via foreign keys) will automatically try to fetch the parent entity if it isn't already fetched.
Default is true.

member.summary: Initializes entity members with data stored in the given DataRow.
member.param: DataRow with the required columns.
member.remarks: FistCore Generator generates constructors that create an entity from data contained in a DataRow so this method is rarely invoked manually.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityModelBase.FromDataRow(System.Data.DataRow,FistCore.Core.IDbTable)
member.summary: Initializes entity members with data stored in the given DataRow.
member.param: DataRow with all or some of the columns defined in meta data.
meta data object which links ADO.NET row columns to entity properties.

remarks.p: This method, when used in combination with objects that contain columns with prefixed aliases (see ), enables you to initialize multiple entities that belong to different tables with data from a single DataRow. This is particularly usefull when fetching an entity with one or more of its parent entities, since all required data can be retrieved in a single select statement.

Generic implementation is not optimized, and should be overriden and optimized in derived classes. Latest version of FistCore generator generates optimized code. Generic implementation is only intended to be used for compatibility purposes, ie. if the code hasn't been regenerated.

remarks.p: Has no affect on entity classes that don't implement data-access logic.
If entity relationship navigation is enabled, the method and properties mapped to parent entities (via foreign keys) will automatically try to fetch the parent entity if it isn't already fetched.

If entity relationship navigation is disabled, the GetParent method and properties mapped to parent entities (via foreign keys) will not automatically access the data-source to fetch the parent entity. Thus, if the parent isn't already initialized, null will be returned.
Default behavior is not standardized. See documentation for classes that implement the IEntity interface.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO
member.summary: Defines methods implemented by all database entity data-access classes.
member.remarks:
Entity DAO requires an instance of IEntity (see ) to work. This is the target entity to which results of data retrieval are stored in (eg. CRUD methods). It also serves as a source of data for other methods (eg. ).
Main features:
CRUD methods. Create, retrieve, update and delete methods that manipulate a single row in the database using primary key logic. All CRUD methods have a suffix One.
Retrieval of parent entities using foreign keys mapped in IDbTable meta classes.
Retrieval of child entities using one-to-many and many-to-many relations.
Batch manipulation and retrieval of multiple rows.
Aggregate functions.
Sorting of retrieved rows on database or in application.
Connection and transaction sharing with other data-tier objects.
Hierarchical queries and updates - methods with a suffix Tree.

member.summary: Sets the sorter used by the data retrieval methods.
member.param: Sort clause. May be null.

member.summary: Sets the sort mode for data retrieveal methods. This is just a hint. Data retrieval methods may ignore this.
member.param: Specifies whether sorting will take place on database or in application after data has been fetched.

member.returns: Number of rows affected.

member.summary: Inserts one new row into the database.
member.returns: Autoidentity value for the inserted row. -1 if the table doesn't contain an autoidentity field or the DBMS specific code cannot be generated.

member.summary: Selects one existing entity from the database based on the Primary Key and populates entity with the retrieved data.
member.remarks: True if select succeeded; false otherwise.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.UpdateOne
member.summary: Updates one existing row in the database.
member.returns: Number of rows affected.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
member.returns: Rows form the child table that reference the current entity through junction table of the M:N relation.
member.remarks: When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table. This can be accomplished by using one of the overloaded FetchChildren methods that accept a parameter.

member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. May be recursive.
Indicates which of the two primary tables in the M:N relation acts as a parent.
member.returns: Rows form the child table that reference the current entity through junction table of the M:N relation.
member.remarks: When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.IDbColumn,System.Object)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
Child field whose value must be equal the given value to be selected.
Value of the given child field. May be null.
member.returns: Rows form the child table that reference the current entity through junction table of the M:N relation and match the given criteria.

remarks.p: Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched. In addition, a SearchCondition may be created which filters out rows from the junction table. See for more information.

When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table. This can be accomplished by using one of the overloaded FetchChildren methods that accept a parameter.

Value of the given child field. May be null.
member.returns: Rows form the child table that reference the current entity through junction table of the M:N relation.

remarks.p: Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched. In addition, a SearchCondition may be created which filters out rows from the junction table. See for more information.

When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table.

FK. Relation to parent table from which parent records are to be fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.SaveCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Persists entities in the collection. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.param: Entities which are to persisted.
Indicates whether auto-identity values assigned to rows by DB are fetched for new/inserted rows. Setting this parameter to false may siginificantly improve performance.

remarks.para: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be saved.

If the fetchAutoIdentityValues parameter is set to false then this method overload will not try to retrieve IDs of the inserted records which may yield significantly better performance. If bulk saving for target DBMS is not implemented then the logic implemented in method overload should be used.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition)

The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
member.returns: All rows in the hierarchy under the current entity, including the current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy starting with the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Maximum number of tree levels to fetch. One specifies that only current entity is fetched, two specifies that current entity and entities directly beneath it are fetched etc.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity, including the current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Zero-based index of the first level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching starts at current entity, one indicates that fetching starts at the level directly beneath it etc.

Zero-based index of the last level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching ends at current entity, one indicates that fetching ends at the level directly beneath it etc. indicates that operation ends at leaf nodes.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.IDbColumn,System.Object,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Child field whose value must be equal the given value to be selected.
Value of the given child field. May be null.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: The method creates a that compares the specified column to the given value. Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.PrimaryTableIndex,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. May be recursive.
Indicates which of the two primary tables in the M:N relation acts as a parent.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.IDbColumn,System.Object,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
Child field whose value must be equal the given value to be selected.
Value of the given child field. May be null.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.

remarks.p: The method creates a that compares the specified column to the given value. Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched. In addition, a SearchCondition may be created which filters out rows from the junction table. See for more information.

When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table. This can be accomplished by using one of the overloaded FetchChildren methods that accept a parameter.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList[],FistCore.Core.DbRelation[])
member.summary: Fetches child entities from multiple tables that reference the current entity.
member.param: Collections to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relations between the current entity's table and child tables. The count and order must match collections.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be fetched.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.Entity
member.summary: Gets or sets entity with which DAO works.
member.remarks: Depending on operation DAO may only read entity, but it may also change it. CRUD operations both read and update entity.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.IEntityDAO.DaoFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets DAO factory. Null is not allowed.
member.remarks: Required to build DAOs for entities used in data-access logic. This factory is passed on to created DAOs so that all DAOs in the chain are created using the same strategies.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.entityDaoCreationStrategies
member.summary: Collection of objects. Required to build DAOs for entities used in data-access logic. This collection is passed on to created DAOs so that all DAOs in the chain are created using the same strategies.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.#ctor(FistCore.Core.IEntity)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of EntityBase class.
member.param: Instance of IEntity. Must be compatibile with current entity; otherwise an exception is generated.

remarks.p: Copy constructor. Copies all class members. Parent entities are not copied by reference, but cloned (deep copy).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.#ctor(FistCore.Core.IDbTable)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of EntityBase class.
member.param: Metadata for table/view to which the entity belongs to.

remarks.p: Sets table/view and the catalog to which this entity belongs to.
Uses only default DAO creation strategies (see ). This can be changed via property.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.#ctor(FistCore.Core.IDbTable,FistCore.Core.IEntityDaoFactory)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of EntityBase class.
member.param: Metadata for table/view to which the entity belongs to.
DAO creation strategies. Null is not allowed.
member.remarks: Sets table/view and the catalog to which this entity belongs to.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.#ctor(System.Type,System.String,FistCore.Core.DbTableProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of EntityModelBase.
member.param: A class that implements interface.
Optional table alias or null if alias is not used.
Optional static method that builds an instance of class specified in the dbTableClass. If null then default implementation using reflection is used.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.connectionIsCreatedLocal
member.summary: Indicates whether the connection is openned locally or is it shared with other objects. If true then Dispose method will dispose ConnectionProvider, otherwise it will leave it intact.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.connectionProvider
member.summary: ConnectionProvider object used for database interaction.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.lastExecutedCommandInfo
member.summary: Information for the last command generated and executed by the current DAO on the data-source.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SetSorter(FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Sets the sorter used by the data retrieval methods.
member.param: Sort clause. May be null.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SetSortMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the sort mode for data retrieveal methods. This is just a hint. Data retrieval methods may ignore this.
member.param: Specifies whether sorting will take place on database or in DataTable after data has been fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.DeleteOne
member.summary: Deletes one existing row in the database based on the primary key and marks the entity as .
member.returns: Number of rows affected.
member.remarks: Throws exception if the parent table doesn't have a primary key constraint or if the primary key fields of the current entity are not set.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.InsertOne
member.summary: Inserts one new row into the database. Affects the current entity state.
member.returns: Autoidentity value for the inserted row. -1 if the table doesn't contain an autoidentity field or the DBMS specific code cannot be generated.

remarks.p: Marks the entity as if the insert operation succeeded and the auto-increment value assigned by the database has been retrieved (if such a field exists). The entity is marked as if auto-increment value cannot be retrieved.
Automatically generates the code that retrieves the new identity for supported databases. DBMS specific code depends on the class' IConnectionProvider.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SelectOne
member.summary: Selects one existing entity from the database based on the Primary Key, populates entity with the retrieved data and marks it as .
member.returns: True if select succeeded; false if primary key is not defined for this table, if the primary key values are not set or if the entity does not exist.
member.remarks: This method does not prefetch parent entities.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.UpdateOne
member.summary: Updates one existing row in the database based on the primary key and marks the entity as .
member.returns: Number of rows affected.

remarks.p: Copies the values from this entity to the row identified by the primary key.
Throws exception if parent table doesn't have a primary key constraint or if the primary key fields of this entity are not set.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.Save
member.summary: Persists entity. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.returns: True if data access operation was executed; false otherwise.
member.remarks:
Executed action and returned value depends on the current :
. Executes method. Returns true.
. No action is executed. Returns false.
. Executes method. Returns true.
. Executes method. Returns true.
. No action is executed. Returns false.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchAllParents

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation[])
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relations from the data source and stores them into current entity.
member.param: Relations (foreign keys) to parents which are to be fetched. Child table of the given FK must be the current entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
member.returns: Parent entities. Some may be null if the required FK fields haven't been set or if the entities with the given key values don't exist.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: An exception is generated if the current entity's primary key value is not set.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.IDbColumn,System.Object,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Child field whose value must be equal the given value to be selected.
Value of the given child field. May be null.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: The method creates a that compares the specified column to the given value. Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table. This can be accomplished by using one of the overloaded FetchChildren methods that accept a parameter.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SaveCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection)
member.summary: Persists entities in the collection. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.param: Entities which are to persisted.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be saved.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SaveCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Persists entities in the collection. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.param: Entities which are to persisted.
Indicates whether auto-identity values assigned to rows by DB are fetched for new/inserted rows. Setting this parameter to false may siginificantly improve performance.

remarks.para: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be saved.

If the fetchAutoIdentityValues parameter is set to false then this method overload will not try to retrieve IDs of the inserted records which may yield significantly better performance. If bulk saving for target DBMS is not implemented then the logic implemented in method overload is used.
Bulk saving is not used for small batches, ie. when there are less than 5 new entities because performance gains are negligible in these cases.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchParentsForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation)
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relation from the data source and stores them into provided child entities.
member.param: Children whose FK properties define which parents are to be fetched.
FK. Relation to parent table from which parent records are to be fetched.
member.returns: Parents retrieved from the data source.

remarks.p: Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).
Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations for each child entity in the collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchParentsForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relation from the data source and stores them into provided child entities.
member.param: Children whose FK properties define which parents are to be fetched.
FK. Relation to parent table from which parent records are to be fetched.

Indicates if all child entities in the collection will share the same parent object instance (same reference). If set to false, a clone of the parent will be created for each child entity in the current collection.
member.returns: Parents retrieved from the data source.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations for each child entity in the collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.FetchChildrenForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation)
member.summary: Fetches children which belong to provided parent entities as defined by the given relation.
member.param: Parent entities referenced by children which are to be fetched.
FK. Relation between parent and child tables.
member.returns: Array of child collections retrieved from the data source. Child collections are in the same order as provided parent objects.

remarks.p: Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).
Preffer using this method instead of a sequance of method invocations for each parent entity in the provided collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition)

member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy starting with the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Maximum number of tree levels to fetch. One specifies that only current entity is fetched, two specifies that current entity and entities directly beneath it are fetched etc.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity, including the current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityBase.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Zero-based index of the first level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching starts at current entity, one indicates that fetching starts at the level directly beneath it etc.

Zero-based index of the last level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching ends at current entity, one indicates that fetching ends at the level directly beneath it etc. indicates that operation ends at leaf nodes.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO
member.summary: Data-access object. Provides standard data-access functionalities to objects that implement interface.

remarks.p: Entity DAO requires an instance of IEntity (see ) to work. This is the target entity to which results of data retrieval are stored in (eg. CRUD methods). It also serves as a source of data for other methods (eg. ).

Main features:
CRUD methods. Create, retrieve, update and delete methods that manipulate a single row in the database using primary key logic. All CRUD methods have a suffix One.
Retrieval of parent entities using foreign keys mapped in IDbTable meta classes.
Retrieval of child entities using one-to-many and many-to-many relations.
Batch manipulation and retrieval of multiple rows.
Aggregate functions.
Sorting of retrieved rows on database or in application.
Connection and transaction sharing with other data-tier objects.
Hierarchical queries and updates - methods with a suffix Tree.

remarks.p: Marks the entity as if the insert operation succeeded and the auto-increment value assigned by the database has been retrieved (if such a field exists). The entity is marked as if auto-increment value cannot be retrieved.
Automatically generates the code that retrieves the new identity for supported databases. DBMS specific code depends on the class' ConnectionProvider.

. Executes method. Returns true.
. No action is executed. Returns false.
. Executes method. Returns true.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchParents(FistCore.Core.DbRelation[])
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relations from the data source and stores them into current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)

Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: An exception is generated if the current entity's primary key value is not set.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.IDbColumn,System.Object,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Relation between the current entity's table and another (child) table. Parent table of the given relation must be this entity's table; otherwise an exception is generated.
Child field whose value must be equal the given value to be selected.
Value of the given child field. May be null.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: The method creates a that compares the specified column to the given value. Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. Very often database is designed so that the child entities are not deleted from the database but are marked as deleted instead. This method may be used when only child rows with a specific status value (eg. STATUS = 1) are to be fetched.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchChildren(System.Collections.IList,FistCore.Core.ManyToManyRelation,FistCore.Core.OrderByClause)
member.summary: Fetches child entities that reference the current entity.
member.param: A collection to fill with entities built from data. Will contain entities from the child table whose foreign key matches this entity's primary key.
Many-to-many relation. Current entity's table acts as a parent table, the other primary table in the relation acts as a child. Resursive M:N relations are not allowed.
Specifies the order in which the entities are added to output collection.
member.remarks: When a single database table is used as both the first and the second primary table of an M:N relation then it must be explicitly specified which one is used as a parent and which one as a child table. This can be accomplished by using one of the overloaded FetchChildren methods that accept a parameter.

remarks.p: The method creates a that compares the specified column to the given value. Only the child rows where the specified column matches the given value are selected. member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.SaveCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection)
member.summary: Persists entities in the collection. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.param: Entities which are to persisted.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be saved.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.SaveCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Persists entities in the collection. Operation (insert, update, delete, nothing) is chosen based on the current .
member.param: Entities which are to persisted.
Indicates whether auto-identity values assigned to rows by DB are fetched for new/inserted rows. Setting this parameter to false may siginificantly improve performance.

remarks.para: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations. Future optimizers will have a better chance to speed up data access when they know in ahead what data is to be saved.

If the fetchAutoIdentityValues parameter is set to false then this method overload will not try to retrieve IDs of the inserted records which may yield significantly better performance. If bulk saving for target DBMS is not implemented then the logic implemented in method overload is used.
Bulk saving is not used for small batches, ie. when there are less than 5 new entities because performance gains are negligible in these cases.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchParentsForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation)
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relation from the data source and stores them into provided child entities.
member.param: Children whose FK properties define which parents are to be fetched.
FK. Relation to parent table from which parent records are to be fetched.
member.returns: Parents retrieved from the data source.

remarks.p: Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).
Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations for each child entity in the collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchParentsForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fetches parent entities defined by the given relation from the data source and stores them into provided child entities.
member.param: Children whose FK properties define which parents are to be fetched.
FK. Relation to parent table from which parent records are to be fetched.

Indicates if all child entities in the collection will share the same parent object instance (same reference). If set to false, a clone of the parent will be created for each child entity in the current collection.
member.returns: Parents retrieved from the data source.
member.remarks: Preffer using this method instead of a sequence of method invocations for each child entity in the collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.FetchChildrenForCollection(FistCore.Core.IEntityCollection,FistCore.Core.DbRelation)
member.summary: Fetches children which belong to provided parent entities as defined by the given relation.
member.param: Parent entities referenced by children which are to be fetched.
FK. Relation between parent and child tables.
member.returns: Array of child collections retrieved from the data source. Child collections are in the same order as provided parent objects.

remarks.p: Child entities with equal FK values will share the same parent object instance (same reference).
Preffer using this method instead of a sequance of method invocations for each parent entity in the provided collection. This method is optimized and may yield significantly better performance.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition)

The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy starting with the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Maximum number of tree levels to fetch. One specifies that only current entity is fetched, two specifies that current entity and entities directly beneath it are fetched etc.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity, including the current entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDAO.SelectTree(FistCore.Core.DbRelation,FistCore.Core.SearchCondition,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.
member.param: Recursive relation which defines a hierarchy.
The search condition which restricts the rows returned. Often a criteria which filters out deactivated records.
Zero-based index of the first level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching starts at current entity, one indicates that fetching starts at the level directly beneath it etc.

Zero-based index of the last level to fetch. Zero indicates that fetching ends at current entity, one indicates that fetching ends at the level directly beneath it etc. indicates that operation ends at leaf nodes.
member.returns: Rows in the hierarchy under the current entity.

member.summary: Gets or sets DAO factory. Null is not allowed.
member.remarks: Required to build DAOs for entities used in data-access logic. This factory is passed on to created DAOs so that all DAOs in the chain are created using the same strategies.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.IEntityDaoCreationStrategy
member.summary: Strategy/algorithm for entity DAO creation.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDaoCreationStrategy.GetEntityDAO(FistCore.Core.IEntity,FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider)
member.summary: Gets DAO that will work the given entity.
member.param: Entity with wich the returned DAO works with.
Connection context DAO will use. If null, default DAO settings are used.
member.returns: IEntityDAO implementation.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy
member.summary: Default strategy/algorithm for entity DAO creation used in FistCore library.
member.remarks: Default algorithm is simple. If IEntity object also implements IEntityDAO interface then it is returned by method. Next, it checks whether the entity's meta-class (IDbTable implementation) specifies a specific DAO creation strategy (see ). If no DAO has been created in previous steps, then the algorithm defaults to generic object which will work the given entity.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy class.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.DefaultEntityDaoCreationStrategy.GetEntityDAO(FistCore.Core.IEntity,FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider)
member.summary: Gets DAO for the given entity.
member.param: Entity which the returned DAO will work with.
Connection context the DAO will use. If null, default DAO settings are used.
member.returns: IEntityDAO implementation.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.IEntityDaoFactory
member.summary: Creates instances of IEntityDAO objects that best suite given entity objects.

remarks.p: Tipically, DAO factory uses a collection of objects to create the an instance of IEntityDAO objects. Some DAO strategies may work for all entities, and some support only specific entity classes. The factory's job is to lookup the best strategy in the collection which will create a DAO that best suites a given entity.

Pattern: one factory class which contains one or more strategies to create a object. The factory should be passed to created DAO by its setter. This way all DAOs created in the same chain will use the same factory, i.e. the same algorithms to create other DAOs. Note: this is required because internally DAOs sometimes create new DAOs to perform data-access operations which are out of scope of original DAO.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.IEntityDaoFactory.GetEntityDAO(FistCore.Core.IEntity,FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider)
member.summary: Gets DAO that will work the given entity.
member.param: Entity with wich the returned DAO works with.
Connection context DAO will use. If null, default DAO settings are used.
member.returns: IEntityDAO implementation.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.EntityDaoFactory
member.summary: DAO factory contains a collection of default and custom creation strategies for specific entity classes.
member.remarks: Contains default and custom strategies for DAOs. Once a strategy is registered for a class it is automatically used for all inherited classes, too. The behavior may be overrided by registering another strategy for inherited class.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDaoFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EntityDaoFactory class.

member.summary: Gets DAO creation strategy for the given entity.
member.param: Entity for which the best registered DAO creation strategy is searched.
member.returns: Most optimal DAO strategy for the given entity. if no custom algorithm has been registered for the entity class or one of its base classes.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.EntityDaoFactory.GetEntityDAO(FistCore.Core.IEntity,FistCore.Core.IConnectionProvider)
member.summary: Gets the most optimal DAO that will work the given entity.
member.param: Entity with wich the returned DAO works with.
Connection context DAO will use. If null, default DAO settings are used.
member.returns: IEntityDAO implementation.

remarks.p: Method will try to find the most optimal DAO creation strategy that will create the most optimal DAO for the given entity.
Current DAO factory is passed on to the created DAO.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.AggregateFunction
member.summary: Represents an SQL aggregate function.

remarks.para: Aggregate functions perform a calculation on a set of values and return a single value. With the exception of COUNT, aggregate functions ignore null values. Aggregate functions are often used with the GROUP BY clause of the SELECT statement. Aggregate functions are allowed as expressions only in the select list of a SELECT statement (either a subquery or an outer query) and a HAVING clause.
AggregateFunction cannot be created by using its constructor. Use to create supported aggregate functions.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn
member.summary: Contains read-only database column metadata and methods.

remarks.para: Provides methods for the creation of the compatibile ADO.NET objects, validation (see ) and contains metadata for the database columns it represents.

SealedDbColumn class implements interface. It implements only setters mandated by interface. All other properties are read-only and guaranted that no attempt will be made to modify underlying data stored in object. This makes it possible to use a single static DbColumnConfiguration object that will be used by all SealedDbColumn instances which represent the same database field. Latest version of FistCore Generator implements code generation that supports the described pattern which significantly optimizes memory usage.

Setters mandated by IDbTable interface are implemented in a very conservative manner. Only property affects internal state of object. Additionaly, property may be used only once. If it is already set then any further attemps to change it are ignored.

When using singleton design pattern for DbColumnConfiguration and IDbTable objects, each new SealedDbColumn instance will only consume additional 8 bytes. This is significantly less than the DbColumn column class where each instance had a variable size averaging between 100 and 200 bytes in most cases.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.#ctor(FistCore.Core.IDbColumnConfiguration,FistCore.Core.IDbTable)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DbColumn class.
member.param: Provides values for immutable properties.
Table or view to which this column belongs to.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.Validate(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the given value is valid for this column.
member.remarks: Checks whether the value contained in the given field obeys basic constraints (nullability, min/max value etc). Returns that indicates the type of error encountered.
member.param: Value.
member.returns: Error code.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.NewDataColumn
member.summary: Creates a new DataColumn that represents this DbColumn in a DataTable.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.GetNormalizedTableAlias
member.summary: Returns normalized table alias that contains only letters and digits.

member.summary: Computes a string which is a combination of prefix (usually table name) and column alias. Eg: Id -> MyTable_Id
member.returns: Prefixed alias.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.RenderColumnName(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders column name for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.
StringBuilder to which table name is appended.
member.remarks: Special characters are handled differently on different DBMSs. Eg. if column contains blanks it has to be enclosed in brackets for SQL Server (eg. [Employee ID]).

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.RenderFullName(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders full name for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.
StringBuilder to which table name is appended.
member.remarks: Special characters in table and column names are handled differently on different DBMSs.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.RenderAlias(FistCore.Core.DbmsType,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders table alias for the given DBMS. Handles special characters.
member.param: Target DBMS.
StringBuilder to which the alias is appended.
member.remarks: Special characters are handled differently on different DBMSs. If alias contains blanks it has to be enclosed in brackets for SQL Server (eg. [My employees]), in quotes for Oracle (eg. "My employees") etc.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.Table
member.summary: Gets or sets object to which this column belongs to.
member.remarks: Table may be only set once. If the property is already set then further attempts to change it are ignored.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.FullName
member.summary: Gets the full name of this column in the following format: TableAlias.ColumnName or only ColumnName if the property is not set. Eg: "MyTable.Id"

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.Alias
member.summary: Gets alias or column name.

remarks.para: Alias is equal to column name, unless parent table specifies that a prefixed alias should be generated. If table's property is set to true then prefixed alias as generated by method is returned.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.Prefix
member.summary: Gets alias prefix. Eg: "MyTable_". Empty string if parent table is not set.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.DbType
member.summary: Gets the of the column. Changes of this property affect the other type properties.

member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether null values are allowed in this column.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.AutoIncrement
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the column automatically increments the value for new rows added to the table.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets the name of the column.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.DataType
member.summary: Gets .NET type of data stored in the column. Changes of this property affect the database type property.

member.name: P:FistCore.Core.SealedDbColumn.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets the default value for the column when creating new rows.

member.summary: Gets the maximum length of a text column. Has no effect it it is not a text column.

member.summary: Gets the position of the column in the database table/view.

member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the column is a part of the primary key.

member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the column is a part of a foreign key.

member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether the value of the field is automatically generated by database (eg. timestamp or computed fields in SQL Server). If set to true then this field's value cannot be inserted or updated.

member.summary: Gets the sequence used to increment values for this field. Must be null if AutoIncrement flag is set to false.

member.summary: Gets the collection of customized information associated with the column.

member.remarks: The ExtendedProperties property lets you configure custom information for the column such as DBMS-specific properties.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.SealedDbTable
member.summary: Contains database table/view metadata and methods. Factory class for related IEntity, EntityCollection and ADO.NET objects.

remarks.para:
Provides methods for the creation of the compatibile ADO.NET objects (see ) and contains metadata for the table/view it represents such as:
Catalog data to which to which the table belongs to.
Table name and optional alias.
Fields owned by the table.
Primary key data.
Foreign keys.

SealedDbTable class implements interface in a more efficient manner than class. It implements only setters mandated by interface. All other properties are read-only and guaranted that no attempt will be made to modify underlying data stored in object. This makes it possible to use a single static IDbTableConfiguration object that will be used by all SealedDbTable instances which represent the same database table/view. Latest version of FistCore Generator implements code generation that supports the described pattern which significantly optimizes memory usage.

Specifies whether columns' aliases are prefixed with a table alias.

StringBuilder to which table name is appended.

StringBuilder to which the alias is appended.

member.name: M:FistCore.Core.SealedDbTable.CreateForeignKeys
member.summary: Initializes an array of relations used by foreign keys. Inherited classes must implement this method. The method is called when property is accessed for the first time.
member.remarks: It is not wise to call this method in a constructor. If a recursive relation is defined, or there is a circular path between multiple tables, an endless loop of CreateForeignKeys might occur. It is best to call the method only when relations are required, i.e. accessed.

member.name: T:FistCore.Core.EntityState
member.summary: Indicates the state of entity in regard to data-source.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityState.New
member.summary:
Entity contains new data, which is not persisted on the data source.
The state is changed to Synchronized after the entity has been inserted. It may switch to OutOfSync after it has been inserted if some fields have remained un-synchronized. Typically, that will happen if auto-incremented value cannot be retrieved after the insert operation.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityState.Synchronized
member.summary:
Entity is synchronized whith the data source. It contains the same data as the respective row in the database.
An entity is considered to be in sync with the database immediately after fetch, update or insert operation has been executed. The state is changed to OutOfSync when the entity data is changed or the referenced row is deleted from the database.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityState.OutOfSync
member.summary:
Entity references an existing row in the database, but the values are different.
An entity is marked as out-of-sync when the values of an entity fetched from the data-source have been modified. The state is changed to Synchronized after the update operation has been executed.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityState.Deleted
member.summary:
Indicates that the row referenced by entity has been deleted from the database.
Executing the update operation on deleted entiy will have no effect, since the row to be updated doesn't exist.

member.name: F:FistCore.Core.EntityState.PendingDeletion
member.summary:
Indicates that the row referenced by entity is to be deleted from the database.
An entity must be manually marked as deletion pending. The state is changed to Deleted after it has been deleted.
